revised_title: The Influence of Voltaic Battery on Nerve Division Effects
tldr: The author, Wilson Philip, conducted experiments to study the effects of dividing the eighth pair of nerves and the influence of the voltaic battery in obviating these effects. He found that when the nerves are divided and the ends are not displaced, digestion occurs if the animal lives for some hours. However, if the ends of the nerves are turned from each other, no digestion takes place. The application of galvanism to the nerves can cause a degree of digestion in the food contained in the stomach, and the animal does not suffer from dyspnoea when galvanized.
